title: "Finding the Power Set" 
---

### ðŸ“– Theory

You will be given an array like {1, 2, 3} or string "abc".
You need to find out all possible subsets like {[], [1], [2], [1,2], [3], [1,3], [2,3], [1,2,3]} or {a, ab, abc, ac, b, bc, c}.

---

**Using Recursion**

```cpp
  Base Case:
    i >= arr.size();

   i        output                            
  {1, 2, 3} , {}
   |                         i      output
   |-- |-- include 1 --> {1, 2, 3} , {1,}
       |                     |                        i    output              
       |                     |-- include 2 --> {1, 2, 3} , {1, 2}
       |                     |                        i    output
       |                     |-- exclude 2 --> {1, 2, 3} , {1,}
       |
       |                     i      output
       |-- exclude 1 --> {1, 2, 3} , {}
       |                     |                        i    output              
       |                     |-- include 2 --> {1, 2, 3} , {2}
       |                     |                        i    output
       |                     |-- exclude 2 --> {1, 2, 3} , {}

Like wise include and exclude the next numbers recursively.

```
